title: UC Santa Cruz advances commitment to social justice with College 10 naming in honor of John R. Lewis
teaser: College Ten—an undergraduate residential learning community founded on principles of social justice and community—will be named in honor of the late congressman and civil rights icon John R. Lewis.

image.text: John R. Lewis stands in front of the Edmund Pettus Bridge

title: UC Santa Cruz named No. 3 public university for 'making an impact'
teaser: Underscoring a reputation of pushing for positive change, UC Santa Cruz has been named the No. 3 public university in the nation for students focused on making an impact on the world in the Princeton Review’s latest college rankings.

image.text: A student examins a catepillar in a UC Santa Cruz greenhouse

title: The collapse of Northern California kelp forests will be hard to reverse
teaser: Most of Northern California's kelp forest ecosystem is gone, replaced by widespread ‘urchin barrens’ that may persist long into the future, according to a new study.

image.text: An urchin barren dominated by purple sea urchins

title: Virtual reality warps your sense of time
teaser: Psychology research demonstrates the unique 'time compression' effect of virtual reality.

image.text: A young person holding virtual reality goggles over their eyes.

title: Mellon Foundation award to support UC Santa Cruz’s ‘Visualizing Abolition’ initiative
teaser: The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation has awarded a $1,977,000 grant to support 'Visualizing Abolition,' the nation's most ambitious and sustained art and prison abolition initiative.

image.text: Solitary Garden, a public art project by New Orleans-based artist Jackie Sumell

title: Karen Tei Yamashita receives 2021 Medal for Distinguished Contribution to American Letters
teaser: Yamashita used her acceptance speech, in part, to emphasize the significance of this medal being awarded to an Asian-American writer "especially this year, post-pandemic, having weathered the Twitter absurdity, corruption, and mendacity; the brutality of racial profiling; and the provocation of anti-immigrant, anti-refugee, anti-Muslim, [and] anti-Asian hatred."

image.text: UC Santa Cruz emerita professor of literature Karen Tei Yamashita

title: NIH funds Center for Live Cell Genomics at UC Santa Cruz
teaser: The NIH Centers of Excellence in Genomic Science program has awarded $13.5 million over five years for a new center to advance genomics in biomedical research.

image.text: DNA strands viosualized with rainbow colors

title: Astronomers witnessed the spectacular death of a star as it happened
teaser: Observations with multiple telescopes yield new insights into the final stages in the evolution of a massive star before it exploded in a core-collapse supernova

image.text: Supernova SN 2020fqv explode inside the interacting Butterfly galaxies.

title: Teens describe their gender and sexuality in diverse new ways, but some are being left behind
teaser: Psychology Professor Phil Hammack’s latest research shows how regional differences and other social factors can either hinder or support expression of diversity in sexual and gender identity among teens and young adults.

image.text: Students gather together, one is draped with the LGTBQ+ flag

title: Blazing a Slug trail to the Olympics
teaser: Rhythmic gymnast Izzy Connor will be the first UC Santa Cruz student to compete in the Olympics—the result of years of both personal struggle and success

image.text: Connor checks in with head coach Margarita Mamzina
